newsitem.title: FRANCE: Arthuis says need to consolidate forex levels.
newsitem.headline: Arthuis says need to consolidate forex levels.

text.p: French Finance Minister Jean Arthuis said on Thursday that current foreign exchange rates were more in line with fundamentals and this must be consolidated in a lasting way.

"Throughout 1996, I said the dollar had room to appreciate. The latest developments on foreign exchange markets have allowed us to reach a situation which is more in line with fundamentals," he told Reuters.
"We must ensure that this development is consolidated in a lasting way," said Arthuis, who will attend a Group of Seven finance ministers meeting in Berlin on Saturday.
"What we must avoid above all, are endless fluctuations which destabilise markets and penalise growth," he added.
Asked whether there were differences between France and Germany on the rise in the dollar, he said "No."

Some newspapers had speculated that France might be keen to see the dollar's recent rise against European currencies continue, while German Bundesbank president Hans Tietmeyer indicated last week he thought the dollar had climbed enough. (( -- Guy Debache Paris Newsroom +33 1 42 21 53 81))
